head.title: DDB Needham Gets Pep Boys Account

hedline.hl1: DDB Needham Gets Pep Boys Account

abstract.p: Pep Boys assigns national advertising account to DDB Needham, unit of Omnicom Group (S)

block.p: The Pep Boys -- Manny, Moe & Jack, the automotive retailer in Philadelphia, assigned its national advertising account yesterday to the DDB Needham Chicago unit of Omnicom Group.
DDB Needham Chicago will handle all aspects of the account, including creative development, strategic planning and media planning and buying.
The Pep Boys -- Manny, Moe & Jack, the automotive retailer in Philadelphia, assigned its national advertising account yesterday to the DDB Needham Chicago unit of Omnicom Group.
DDB Needham Chicago will handle all aspects of the account, including creative development, strategic planning and media planning and buying.

The previous agency, the Cliff Freeman & Partners unit of Saatchi & Saatchi P.L.C. in New York, had handled only the creative duties. Freeman resigned from those duties in January when Pep Boys placed the account in review. At that time, billings were estimated at $25 million; Pep Boys estimated them yesterday, however, at more than $40 million.

The other finalists in the review besides DDB Needham Chicago were Bates USA in New York, a unit of Cordiant Communications Group P.L.C., and Goodby, Silverstein & Partners in San Francisco, also owned by Omnicom.
